00054 
00055 /*
00056   parameter format for XVDig1394::set_params is a string of "XnXn..."
00057   where X is the parameter character and n is the corresponding value
00058   valid characters and their values:
00059   B : number of buffers ( same as defined in XVVideo.h )
00060   R : pixel format from camera, 0 = YUV422, 1 = RGB, 2 = MONO8,
00061                                 3 = MONO16, 4 = YUV411, 5 = YUV444
00062                     default = 0 
00063   S : scale, 0 = any, 1 = 640x480, 2 = 320x200, 3 = 160x120, 
00064              4 = 800x600, 5 = 1024x768, 6 = 1280x960, 7 = 1600x1200
00065           default = 0
00066   M : scale (obsolete), M0 = S4, M1 = S5, M2 = S6, M3 = S7
00067   C : whether to grab center of the image or not, 0 = no, 1 = yes, default = 0
00068       note that C1 implies format 7
00069   T : external trigger, 0 = off, 1-4 = mode 0-3, or directly supply the
00070                         number to the camera. default = 0
00071   f : directly set IEEE 1394 camera format (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00072       if the value is 7, S values are still used.
00073   m : directly set IEEE 1394 camera mode   (as oppose to set R and S/M)
00074       note that this parameter should not to set for format 7
00075   r : frame rate, 0 = 1.875, 1 = 3.75, 2 = 7.5, 3 = 15, 4 = 30, 5 = 60 (fps)
00076                   default = fastest under selected format and mode
00077   g : gain
00078   u : u component for the white balance
00079   v : v component for the white balance
00080   s : saturation
00081   A : sharpness
00082   h : shutter
00083   a : gamma
00084   x : exposure
00085   o : optical filter
00086  */
00087 
00088 typedef enum
00089 {
00090   BAYER_Not_Valid=-1,
00091   BAYER_PATTERN_GBRG,
00092   BAYER_PATTERN_BGGR,
00093   BAYER_PATTERN_RGGB,
00094   BAYER_PATTERN_GRBG,
00095 }bayer_pattern_type;
00096 
00097 template <class IMTYPE>
